website_summaries.verdict: A fun and engaging toy with bug-like realness.
pros: Toy's movement accurately resembles an insect
Subtle buzzing noise keeps cats engaged and curious
Toy moves easily around corners and through tight spaces
cons: Toy does not work well on carpeted floors

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: He loves it...however...the bug went to somewhere under the oven, and disappeared... My cat has been like this for two days...
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Super fun toy for kittens
customer_reviews.text: It gets 5 stars because it's an absolutely brilliant cat toy and the only one of the kind I could find. It's not perfect however. It still needs a little supervising as it can get stuck under furniture and my kitty comes to find me when it happens (quite often) It stops working after several minutes. Not sure if it is a safety thing or just a problem. If I turn it off, after a few minutes it works again. Considering the abuse it gets from my kitten, I find this perfectly acceptable. I just hope it won't break quickly. As you can see from the video, my kitty loves it.
customer_reviews.author: ceg123

customer_reviews.title: A piece of garbage
customer_reviews.text: I turned the bug on, and my cat loved it. The bug crawled around for no more than 20 seconds before my cat grabbed it. She had the bug in her claws & the feather in her mouth and gave the feather a good tug. The bug stopped working right then & won't come back on. I took the battery out in case it was dislodged & put it back in, but the bug still doesn't work. Nothing happens when it's turned on. Give your cat the plastic ring from your milk jug instead & save your money.
customer_reviews.author: ngw

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous toy
customer_reviews.text: My cats loved it, it got their attention right away. But, it only lasted one day. If they think is a bug, they'll want to eat the bug, and that really worries me. They chew it to pieces, and the electronic parts are all exposed, i don't even know if they swallowed something , i have 6 cats. You have an advisory of choking hazard for children. What about our loved pets? It should be sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Magaly Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited, I received it yesterday January 15, 2018. My cat played with the toy and after around 10 minutes I turned it off. Today my husband told me it wouldn't turn on. I just tried it and it's not working 😑
customer_reviews.author: Akilah

customer_reviews.title: So Tiny That It's a Choking Hazard
customer_reviews.text: The thing is tiny and I DO mean tiny. It's a choking hazard and I wouldn't let any cat play with it unsupervised. And I would store it out of their reach when not in use. The thing doesn't work on carpet, only tile and wood floors. And it constantly needs to be redirected by a human when it gets stuck. Our cats were mildly amused, then went back to plotting insurrection.
customer_reviews.author: Wretched Excess

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: While my cat really enjoyed this item, after only using 4 times or so it stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: jrun

customer_reviews.title: Cat loved this toy but I had to get up every ...
customer_reviews.text: Cat loved this toy but I had to get up every couple of minutes to fix something. Problem solved on day 2 when it broke.
customer_reviews.author: water5me

customer_reviews.title: Great product for all cat owners!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 4 year old male tabby cat PROS: -Rights itself after turning over -Keeps my cat's interest -Buzzing sound keeps you from losing it -Picks up fur/dust/hair balls along the way (not sure if this is a pro or con!) CONS: -No auto off -Gets stuck on something every 30 min or so -Does not run on any type of carpet Please rate this review as HELPFUL if it helped you make a decision!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Can't return defective product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this toy as a replacement for one that was lost. The original one was great - it ran in a straight line until it hit something, then turned away and continued on a new path. This toy simply moves in a tight circle in the same spot. I received it today and went to my order page to click on "return" - but it's marked ineligible for return. It's useless and going in the trash. The cats really enjoyed the original one, however I won't be ordering it again if there's a chance of throwing away money for another defective one.
customer_reviews.author: Transient1

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is TINY. It doesn't move on carpet, only on the hard floor and really just moves in small circles so the cat can catch it pretty easily. It was more fun for them when I turned it off and they grabbed it by the feather tail and could throw it up in the air.
customer_reviews.author: JenMTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Inferior product will stop working after half a dozen one time two minute plays :(
customer_reviews.text: Takes one button battery which only provides about ten total minutes play. Being pro-active with saving power, only ran it a minute or two on tile floor. Second time new battery, tried both sides with three brand new batteries—NOTHING!!!! My poor two-yr-old Charlie keeps meowing, moving it, watched me always trying the get it running!!!!! Would appreciate a full replacement of one, if not yep, to actually get my money’s worth from it. Will update if Amazon does right....otherwise don’t bother getting your car all excited with it, only for it to be a short-lived has NotFun tease!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 3.7 minutes
customer_reviews.text: It came with a battery....I turned it on and it ran around for less than 4 minutes, then ran out of 'energy'. So, either it's a worthless piece of junk, or it came with a defective battery, which I now need to go find a new one and waste money on. Don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: GeCha

customer_reviews.title: Batteries die fast and choking hazard for pets
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves these! However, the batteries die very quickly! I let her play with it on for about 20 min 30 min at a time and then turn it off to give it a break. I even bought 4 more (1 of the four came doa and even replacing the battery didn't fix it) thinking I can alternate them to get more time. Didn't work... after about a week later the batteries all need to be replaced. You also need to supervise your pets when they play with this since these are very small. Not suitable for kittens or cats that like to chew or put it in their mouth.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3 month old kitten that absolutely loved this thing but lost it the first day playing with it so I ordered him another one a few days later and it died within the first hour. Very disappointed because it really kept him entertained. The seller does not offer refunds.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndie

customer_reviews.title: Worth It!
customer_reviews.text: Nifty toy. Even my cat, who is jaded with most toys, found this interesting enough to chase. It moves right along and changes direction when it hits an object. Be careful - the Hexbug can find the smallest opening! On the first use, it found a small opening between the stove and a cabinet and I had a heck of time getting it out. If the Hexbug flips over, it does not self-right. Instead, it gets entangled in the string it pulls.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Lasts 30 seconds! and NO REFUND
customer_reviews.text: My cat broke this in a few days, so giving the product the benefit of the doubt, I ordered again. This time it took 30 SECONDS for him to bite it apart and break it. How can you make a pet toy that cannot stand up to a regular sized cat playing with it for under 1 minute? I am giving two stars only because in the brief time it worked, he was very interested in it. Unless you have a weak kitten, save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Glen

customer_reviews.title: Cats LOVE these, need decent batteries to experience full effects
customer_reviews.text: Our cats love these, almost as much as the cardboard boxes from Amazon that were free... They scoot across the hard floors by themselves, turning and making their way around as if they had a mind of their own. They are very well made and durable. The cats haven't been able to tear these apart like they do so many other harder-plastic-ish toys. When they get turned upside down or on their side, they will right themselves. HOWEVER, if your batteries are weak, they do not have enough power to do that. I won't waste a half good battery, so our cats are forced to endure playtime with them until the batteries are dead before I change them.
customer_reviews.author: Jay R. Baker

customer_reviews.title: my cats love these
customer_reviews.text: My cats are fascinated by these bugs. But I don't let them play unsupervised because the bugs tend to go behind furniture and underneath things (like the oven) that are hard to get them out of, so I do need to watch where these bugs are going. Also, vacuum your floor before putting these things down because they'll pick up every piece of dust, fur, and hair they encounter, and you'll need to clean them out at the end of the play session. Otherwise, like I said, the cats like them and that's all that matters. They're weird little things, kind of freaky, like they have a mind of their own.
customer_reviews.author: see jane read

customer_reviews.title: Best cat toy yet! well made, not a cheaply made toy
customer_reviews.text: This little guy has entertained my 2 cats for weeks- their favorite. I don't have to do anything besides keep an eye on them. It gets over most small hurdles. rights itself back on its feet 99% of the time, cats easily right it back up when they don't want the wait the 2-3 seconds it takes to right itself. Even fun for me to marvel at how this thing manuvers. Only noise is it legs on hardwood almost no motor sound at all. super quiet. I really can't say enough about this. I have 1 and have sent 2 as gifts, they LOVE them I'm ordering more today. FUN FUN FUN, not a cheaply made toy.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Absoluelty a Must Have Toy!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is over the top wonderful. Our 5 mos old kitten adores it! All we need to say is "Let's find Bug," and he immediately runs to its storage place. It definitely encourages his hunting skills and makes him use his brain when he has to turn it over or dislodge it from under the rugs. It likes hardwood floors best but can handle thin rugs, too. The battery is easy to install and has aprety long life, as well. I wish it could turn itself off but for the price, you can't expect everything. If I were to recommend only one interactive toy for a cat this would be it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy H. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Well thought out cat toy
customer_reviews.text: My cats loved this toy. I have three indoor kitties and they were all immediately engaged. One finally took to his favorite place. Another went to retrieve it back to the linoleum. It doesn't do well on carpet. It is about the size of a small mouse. The tail is right. It is not noisy and has soft plastic for the body and legs. It self rights well and doesn't seem to get stuck in by most obstacles. It goes in random circles. I have to go and see if the battery is still working. It does fit under our refrigerator so it may get lost. :)
customer_reviews.author: Bird Feeder

customer_reviews.title: cats favorite toy (and he has many)
customer_reviews.text: i have almost as much fun watching the cat play as he does playing. a great inexpensive toy that continuously moves even if flipped on it's back (like on wide cracks on deck - goes right across more narrow cracks) it buzzes and tries to go which also keeps the cats interest. he often picks it up by the feather and takes it to his "lair" and rolls and tosses it and plays more than with any other toy. haven't had opportunity to leave it on long enough to check battery life but so far even with 30 minutes playing it's fine. can't leave it with cat, he'll hide it...lol.
customer_reviews.author: RNx30yrs

customer_reviews.title: Best interactive toy for cats
customer_reviews.text: I have spent an infinite amount of money in the past on interactive toys for my cat. Most she just sits there and stares at......."what the heck is that"????? This toy she loves, loves, loves and can't get enough of. I bought 3 and sometimes (just to screw with her) I'll run 2 at a time. It's about the closest thing to a real bug (roach) as you can get. The only reason I'm giving it only 4 stars is because you have to watch it, otherwise if it ends up under and appliance or furniture it can be very difficult to retrieve. I'm sure I will be purchasing many more of them in the future. LOL!!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda L

customer_reviews.title: Stockpile these with LR44 batteries for a happy life
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 cats (rescues and fosters). They all LOVE this toy. It’s brought peace and harmony to my home because all 4 girls will chase after these things together! They seem to say: the enemy of my enemy is my friend. 😸 The battery lasted two days with extensive use on each day. I have a 12-pack of LR44 batteries though so there’s really no end in sight. This little bug recovers from flips and corners. The only trouble I have is that it’s short enough to get under my closet doors. When I have a clowder of cats staring at me, I know it’s time to go unearth the bug.
customer_reviews.author: PW

customer_reviews.title: Cat is obsessed with this
customer_reviews.text: This was a smash hit with our cat so we bought her a second one. Also, the first one is missing due to whatever adventures and hijinks she got into. She becomes aware of it right when we turn it on, running over to the closet where we keep it. (It’s not something you wanna leave on all the time.) It’s endlessly entertaining to our cat, who at first growled at it (!) and now basically lives for chasing this thing, trotting away with it in her mouth, batting at it, keeping watch over it once she has “killed” it, etc. Great stimulation for a cat’s hunting instinct. Any cat owner would love this.
customer_reviews.author: Em Pem

customer_reviews.title: Easy cat entertainment
customer_reviews.text: As expected, it's super for hard floors. When it bumps into an area rug or other obstacle, it redirects. I've removed the trailing 'tail' because the bug sometimes got snarled in it and my cat is just as happy. Less drag also means the battery lasts longer, which does last a surprisingly long time. Occasionally it gets caught in a corner or goes under furniture, so you have to keep watching it and turn it off when your cat is done with playtime. I recommend buying the multi-battery pack which is MUCH lower cost than store pricing.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho Lady

customer_reviews.title: The inventor must have been a kinky cat person
customer_reviews.text: I swear this toy is just a small bullet vibrator with the rubbery teeth off of one of those gum-massaging toothbrushes. But I digress, because my cat really loves it. It's actually quite brilliant. It can get into places that you don't want it (like under the bed/couch/dressers/FURNITURE) but it seems to get itself out of the maze just fine too. I'd definitely recommend to watch your pet use it and make sure there's no holes it can fall into or let it get under appliances. It will come out all covered with dust. Expect that. A+, really amusing to watch my cat play with.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Van Eycke

customer_reviews.title: Battery died in two days and its a challenge to change it
customer_reviews.text: This was so tiny a pet or child could swallow it , now i got this for my kitty she loves to chase things i have carpet it is for floors but i got in in my kitchen floor battery only lasted about 2 days and its very hard to get the batteries and undo the whole thing my cat just carries it everywhere but battery died so fast i only gave it a good use for two days.
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great idea with a few flaws
customer_reviews.text: This idea is so novel. It looks like a bright green furry caterpillar being pulled across the floor by a tiny car. My cat is very fussy, and her favorite toy is ME interacting with HER (not my favorite toy). This does keep her interested for quite a while as she follows it around the floor, but she only pokes at it when it gets stuck in a corner. And it doesn't right itself and will get stuck whenever it's not FLOOR, so this toy has also become somewhat interactive. I'm glad I bought it, but I think I'll buy a remote-controlled mouse now. Comes with a charger, and the battery lasts for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the funniest and coolest cat toy. Entertaining for both cat and human. Cat still doesn't know what to make of it, will just follow it around...but will not stop meowing for it when I put it away. Each time is scuttles to another room, cat quickly follows. It does go through the cell battery pretty quickly (was using it all day), but not a big deal to buy a bulk order (fairly cheap) of batteries on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Lauralee Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Best cat toy EVER!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cat toy I have EVER bought! It's essentially cat-proof in the right circumstances. I don't have to manually move it, my cat loves it, and it has such realistic movements it actually creeped me out at first! Others have said that it never rights itself when it flips over, but mine turns right side up every time without failure! It hasn't gotten snagged on anything except carpet. The only "downside" is having to supervise it so it doesn't go under the fridge or oven. I almost lost it because it found a little crevice I didn't know about, but holy cow is it realistic! 100% worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Molina

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Seem To Like It
customer_reviews.text: I saved this for a rainy day, when my cats don't like to be out (cat fenced yard), but get more bored inside the house. It kept them interested for quite a while, although they were more cautious than I expected. It did keep getting stuck here & there, which I suppose is to be expected. The little tail that it drags, caught all of our cat-hair dust bunnies! Honestly, I wish they made this about 6 inches longer, with the ability to pull a Swiffer duster refill behind it! It could double as a cleaning tool AND a cat toy!
customer_reviews.author: Hydrangea Butternut

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Harry loved this toy!! At first he just watched it go around but then when he was realized it could go under the table & back out that was a game changer. Now its ..game on. Fun all the time, trying to keep in under that table! I'd highly recommend this interactive cat toy. However, I would also say, you need CV to keep you eye on your cat while playing with it. It can run under doors & things so your cat will wonder where it had gone. Someone must rescue it!😊
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Super fun toy for cats and for me
customer_reviews.text: A friend had one of these and asked me to put in a new battery. While I had it, I tried it out with my new older cat and she was totally focused on this. So I ordered my own. This is so much fun. It only works on hard surfaces and you have to keep an eye on it so that it doesn't get stuck under the sofa so, in fact, both of us are focused on this silly thing. I am totally pleased with this. I turned it off and put it away and the cat is still trying to figure out what just happened. Great fun.
customer_reviews.author: Clutter Hater

customer_reviews.title: Tiny thing
customer_reviews.text: The concept sounded good but the result not so... I bought this toy for Luna, my kitten. Unfortunately, the first thing one will see is that it does not work on carpet, especially the thick one. The second thing is that even in vinyl floor, it works so so. The third thing is that my kitten lost interest extremely fast with it. It is sad because it was a great concept. In conclusion: No I cannot really recommend it. I do not even know where it is right now... 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Henri Savin

customer_reviews.title: cat loves it, but the battery is weak
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy so much, and so does my cat. I have spent a loooottt of money in trying to entertain her while at work and this toy just blew her mind. the BIG issue is the fact that the battery dies extremely fast, and finding replacements its pretty hard, let alone that u need to buy a mini screw to remove it since it doesn't come with the toy. will buy again but I think they need to come up maybe w a rechargeable one.
customer_reviews.author: "M"

customer_reviews.title: Attractive toy for feather lovers!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cat who loves feathers. He was immediately attracted to the lightweight feather attached to the back of the bug and once I turned the bug ON it was a game changer. He loved loved loved it! He’ll paw at it or just lay down and enjoy watching it (he’s 9). The good thing is it rights itself if it gets knocked off its feet. The bad thing is the batteries only last about a week and there is no timer so you have to go find it to turn it off once your cat wanders away. It is a great toy though. Just buy the batteries in bulk because you’ll have to change them often.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Cats Love It!
customer_reviews.text: The toy vibrates, which causes it to move around the floor like a big. It does not do well on rugs or carpet, so keep that in mind. Our younger cat will carry it around like a freshly caught mouse, even if the switch is turned off. Yes, you have to set it upright occasionally. You also need to keep an eye on dogs and small children to make sure it doesn’t end up in their mouths. I definitely recommend this toy to keep your cats stimulated. I just ordered a second one, so we have backup.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M.

customer_reviews.title: Instantly became my cat's "precious" toy!
customer_reviews.text: She LOVES IT!!! Thanks to another reviewer, I blocked off areas where it would not be retrievable, such as under the refrigerator. I also attempted to keep it corralled in a tray, but my cat quickly defeated that. She likes to pick it up by it's furry tail and carry it around. It does make some noise, and thank goodness for that, as that helps to track down wherever it ended up. My cat just loves it, and supervision is required so it doesn't get lost. I am quite happy with how happy she is.
customer_reviews.author: Purgandi Dracointerfectorem

customer_reviews.title: Cats are weird.
customer_reviews.text: Ehhhh. Cats are picky. I have seen numerous kittens go berserk for this thing in videos, but my cat (not mature & not not a chonk—so I don’t really get the issue) just looked on as if I am an idiot. Oh well. I returned it, not based on her indifference, but due to the fact that it does not “self-right” despite not even being touched. I recommend getting an actual nano or hex bug toy for less gullible felines. Also, i would ask they lower the price since it doesn’t perform as touted.
customer_reviews.author: Novnelson

customer_reviews.title: FUN...While it lasted 🙁
customer_reviews.text: I’m sitting here, half flabbergasted, half pissed as the timeline with this toy went like this: 5:30pm - Retrieved Amazon package from porch 5:40pm - Presented to kitten (who warmed to it quickly and seemed to love pouncing on it!) 5:47pm - Took a phone call 6:02pm - Phone call over - Hexbug is gone!! The thing is super small and my kitty has probably pinched it to some carpeted part of the house where I can’t hear it buzzing - but sheesh, I waited for delivery for 2 weeks for 22 mins of play - WOW!!!
customer_reviews.author: LadyHunt

customer_reviews.title: Great entertainment for my cat but still needs supervision
customer_reviews.text: This is keeping my cat thoroughly entertained and for that I love it. You do have to be there to keep an eye on it because sometimes the tail gets caught up in the legs and prevents it from detangling itself All in all, it's great and keeps my cat occupied giving me a break because she's a very "needy" cat, always wanting to be petted and played with. The only problem is that it often gets tangled in its tail feathers if my cat swipes it in a certain way and when that happens, the toy just stays on its side and circles until you untangle it.
customer_reviews.author: Meema

customer_reviews.title: The cat loves playing with it
customer_reviews.text: While it only moves when it’s right side up, it moves at a comfortable speed and generally in a big circle. This is nice because it seldom ends up under the furniture. My cat really enjoys it and plays with it a lot, not growing bored. And even when he knocks it over he still paws at it because the sound volume increases when it’s upside down. He generally manages to get it righted and off it goes again. The movements are a pretty good imitation of how a bug moves. My cat recommends it!
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Man

customer_reviews.title: BEST TOY EVER!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is so good, even the stray cat likes it! (video is of the stray) My oldest cat who never plays with toys, actually plays with this! My younger cat who loves playing LOVES this toy SO much. Even the stray cat likes this toy! First toy he ever played with that didn’t scare him! I actually ended up buying him his own (mostly because I didn’t want my cats playing with a toy he touched incase he has FIV) LOVE THIS TOY I recommend it to all the cat owners I know. SO AWESOME
customer_reviews.author: Lyndsay Simon

customer_reviews.title: Cat Approved.
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool little toy. Most importantly, my cat loves it. It moves around in circles until my cat knocks it on it’s side, or it gets tangled with the string that is the tail. At this point it sometimes corrects itself and other times me or my cat have to knock it back over. It doesn’t work on the carpeting at my place. Another issue is since it is so little it easily crawls under doors and other small spaces. In this sense it is rather mouse-like, which I think my cat enjoys. I really like it for when my cat has a lot of energy and wants to play, but I am busy. I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: This is not a toy suitable for a cat. It is very small and they could easily swallow it whole and choke or die. It is nothing more than a vibrating piece of plastic with a feather attached to the end.
customer_reviews.author: Kay Adams

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the purchase-cats love it it buzzes cicada- like!
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve only just received this and set him lose for my cats but they went nuts over it. Trying to out-hunt each other, toss it in the air, bat it the whole 9 yards. It is very small maybe the size of 1.5 jolly ranchers long so I would not leave it unsupervised for a length of time. My two just turned a year in April so not little kittens that play with anything, but still quite young. We’ll see if it peaks the interest of my 7 or 12 yr olds...when they wake up 😸
customer_reviews.author: Val K

customer_reviews.title: Cats enjoy it
customer_reviews.text: My cats love it, I hate it. I have to watch it when it's turned on because it will either make a beeline for something large (fridge/oven/tv stand) and immediately get stuck under it or as much cats play with it, it continously gets stuck on its back and makes the most annoying sound on my hardwood floors. I would recommend it just in the fact that my cats love it. They haven't gotten bored with it yet and one will play with it regardless of if its on or not.
customer_reviews.author: Meda

customer_reviews.title: WTAF USPS? Who steals from cats?!
customer_reviews.text: Not the fault of seller, but I hope whomever lost (or stole) two cat toys is happy. Been waaay too long, and tracking updates say it's in one spot (Orlando) and then either fell into a vortex or someone decided to steal them. Blame solely with USPS. But am sorely disappointed for my cats. Honestly, who steals from cats? Wish I never ordered because I'm sad now. They love things like this and would have been happy. Tracking number never updates, tho I set it to update daily. Just says it left Kentucky. -sigh- Disappointed. Will request refund soon.
customer_reviews.author: P. A. Potter

customer_reviews.title: Cat likes it, battery life horrible.
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasted with 10 days of use, using about 10 minutes a day then my cat would get bored. Luckily we had an extra battery to change it, which was easy to do. Doesn't run on our carpet either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if anyone else has this "issue" but our hexbug mostly makes right turns, ending up kinda going in circles and therefore making it uninteresting for our cat. She loves to hunt (5 years old) but more watches it than actually play. I think this would be great for kitten or cats that aren't crazy active and don't want/need to run so probably more for seniors and/or heavy cats and/or cats that can't/shouldn't run around as much. It's definitely great to keep a cats brain active if that makes sense. Just seeing the poofy face, ears forward, focusing on this thing is adorable.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Thompson Walker

customer_reviews.title: The feather should be attached a littler better. A playful cat would probably detach it fairly ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat isn't as amused as I'd hoped. She isn't very playful. I'm sure most cats are well entertained by these. My toddler loves his Hexbugs, so we added this to his collection. The feather should be attached a littler better. A playful cat would probably detach it fairly quickly. The speed of this is very fast, just like the regular Nanobug. It turns well when it hits objects in it's path. The loud noise of it moving is what interested my cat the most. The feather collects a lot of dirt, even when you think your floor is clean. Battery life is good, haven't replaced yet.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great for non-carpeted floors
customer_reviews.text: This little thing moves like a real bug, and is a little bigger than one. I like it, but I can only use it in the kitchen because our apartment is carpeted everywhere else. I can't leave the cat alone with it however because it will go under the fridge or shelving unit easily unless you prevent it. The cat is fascinated and while she doesn't paw at it that often, her eyes are riveted on it as long as it's on. Nothing wrong with the product so five stars, but it's not very practical if you have a lot of carpeting in your house.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Stoffel

customer_reviews.title: Favorite toy...ever
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Hexbug. I inadvertently sent the first one went through the washer and dryer. But except for that final gauntlet, it performed remarkably well for many months. I invested in very good batteries (not very expensive) and had to change the battery much less often. My cats are hyperactive, and it takes a whole lot to keep them occupied. This is the only toy that does so. Warning--Hexbug can go anywhere and will go anywhere, such as down vents and behind immovable objects. I now set mine on a round serving tray on the floor with a couple of other toys for the bug to navigate. My two are mesmerized every time.
customer_reviews.author: benefit

customer_reviews.title: So much fun for kitty and me!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toy - it really engages my cat and even though he hits it, it always gets back on its feet and runs away. I have a lot of rugs in my apartment, so I don't have an entire floor space. I have used it under the bed on the floor and it goes around objects, the cat chases it. I made the mistake of putting it in the kitchen and it got under the refrigerator! Made a terrible noise - I moved the fridge and it came out. Really fun. I don't know how long the battery lasts yet... My cat gets bored with things, not this one, the movement keeps his attention.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Schickel

customer_reviews.title: depends on your cat, I think
customer_reviews.text: When we first set this down, the one cat hissed at it, clearly dubious about the toy, while the other batted it several times. The second time? A couple of swats while she followed it around. She pays a little attention to it now, but doesn't really 'play' with it. I think it's all on how much your cat pounces on bugs or something (they love the wands and laser lights). It is a nice toy - it will skitter around on hard surfaces and turn around when it hits walls or most things.
customer_reviews.author: nekojita

customer_reviews.title: Adult cats not that interested
customer_reviews.text: This toy is a very good idea that doesn't quite work well. It continuously turns in tight circles, I think because of the drag of the tail. My cats watched it intently until they lost interest when it didn't go anywhere. One cat batted it around a few times. I was worried that the noise would make them back off but it wasn't loud enough to bother them as some battery operated toys I've bought in the past did. This might be a great toy for a kitten.
customer_reviews.author: mgfauxpas

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this bug!
customer_reviews.text: My cats are fascinated by this bug!! They are both a bit older and I keep looking for toys that might interest them and this one is definitely one of the few! I do have to supervise their playtime with the bug - as the bug is small (and one of my cats loves chewing on plastic), plus the bug often likes to go under furniture and get stuck there. But, I would recommend it to other cat owners as it really seems to get my cats' attention every time!
customer_reviews.author: Lila

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME CAT TOY
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical when I purchased this, but I took the leap anyway. This thing is very cool. It's similar to a robot vacuum, where it senses something in front of it and tries to go around. My cat can't get enough of it. Only downside, if your couch isn't touching the ground, it can get under there & get stuck. We've had it happen a few times, but I always notice because my cat just sits there looking at the side of the couch, waiting for her toy to come back out.
customer_reviews.author: Marissa Rice

customer_reviews.title: Fun, Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked to see how much my cat loves this toy. It is by far her favorite. It's really funny to see it scurrying (vibrating) across the floor with her in pursuit. I've also been amazed how long the battery has lasted. I've had it for over a year and it's just now showing signs of battery failure. I highly recommend this toy, but as all cat lovers know that doesn't mean their cat will give it the time of day. Great product. High quality. Lots of fun for my fur baby.
customer_reviews.author: JSco

customer_reviews.title: Depends on your cats personality
customer_reviews.text: This toy really depends on your cats personality. I have 2 cats. One of them got into it right away, chasing and attacking it. The other one was satisfied just watching it from a distance. I had to place cardboard in a couple of areas such as in front of a bookshelf to prevent it from going under but that’s minor. The cat that likes it even learned how to move it off the carpet when she flips it onto it. It doesn’t climb onto carpets, even throw rugs. My cat catches it and flips it in the air where it lands on the carpet.
customer_reviews.author: S. Forkin

customer_reviews.title: A winner despite just going in a small circle
customer_reviews.text: My boy LOVES this. It worked great for about the 1st week, but now seems to want to just go in a small circle. I make this more interesting for my boy by putting things in it's way so that it has to make it's way around them, which causes it to go out of sight of my cat...which he loves as he then stalks it. PS buy extra batteries, as they don't last long; I bought a 20 pack for just a few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: JWI

customer_reviews.title: Acts like a real bug!
customer_reviews.text: 3 out of 3 cats approve! This is great...it moves erratically, but like a real bug skittering across the floor. When the cat bops it, it may flip on to its back, but it does right itself. It has a low buzzing sound that is realistic, and it changes direction when it encounters an obstacle. Sometimes the “tail” gets tangled in the bug, and that does affect its moving, but the cat whacking it again usually rights it. If you have issues, just remove the tail...the cats like it a lot without it. There is a switch, so you can conserve battery life. Takes a standard watch battery (circular).
customer_reviews.author: Amber S Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2 - One is great - other moves in tight circles only
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 based on the reviews - one was a gift for a pet sitting client. One runs randomly around and their cat loves it. The other one only goes in tight circles - my cat almost immediately grew bored and walked away. The dog was more interested than the cat! I can't speak to battery life, but the bug did seem to be able to right itself. The thread that goes to the fluffy part of the tail gets hung in things easily and also got caught up in the cat's paw.
customer_reviews.author: Jules C

customer_reviews.title: If l had all the money i've spent on toys they dont give a 💩 about..
customer_reviews.text: I'd buy a bunch of these!! I have 8 year old tuxedo sisters. Very laid back and not at all interested in stupid toys,thankyouverrrrymuch.lt was a lightening deal what the heck--lts cute, maybe just maybe.... WELL!! They love this thing! They run and jump and play like kittens. You have to monitor a little because it us very small and can get stuck under things. My girls tend to try to retrieve it themselves, but if they need help they come sit and stare at me until i get up and get the thing. When they get tired they flop down on their sides and watch it . great little toy.
customer_reviews.author: shereadsalot

customer_reviews.title: Best without a tail. Fun for animals.
customer_reviews.text: A hexbug is fun, but it would have been funner if it was bigger. Like a hexbug, this one tended to turn one direction. I think it is because of the tail on the end that it kept on running over. As a hexbug, it was fun (for our dog, not our kitten), yet I think it would have been funner if it wasn't such a tiny morsel. They also liked this hexbug without the tail, then they would with it, while the tail was easily taken off.
customer_reviews.author: Maiden Of Honor

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining but gets stuck
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I'm a full time student and I needed something that could give my cats some extra entertainment with minimal work required from me. My cats love these. They are just like a bug so they mostly stare at them or follow them around. It was a little disappointing that these don't work on carpet, but I sorta expected it. Still some good entertainment. I just have to sit next to them and flip them every once in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: your cat will love them!
customer_reviews.text: They love these! And the bug never stops moving- drop off a counter, into its back- it rights itself and keeps going. Run into another nanobug? They untangle and keep going. These things navigate all walls, corners surfaces (except carpet/rugs and under stoves) better than DJ Roomba. Seriously. Roomba should give up and let the nano people take over. My cats hunt these all over the house, and love to catch them in that box ( the box is totally separate item I bought years ago) Whether in the box, like my video, or on the floor, cats love these!!!
customer_reviews.author: Juice Inla

customer_reviews.title: Not worth 10 cents
customer_reviews.text: This toy worked for about an hour and then died. My cats did like it but even after buying batteries and replacing them 2 times it still didn't work. The company sent me a replacement toy and it worked for only 15 min and died. I was issued a refund
customer_reviews.author: Sandra F.

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this but.....
customer_reviews.text: This toy is VERY tiny. My cat loves it but when it bumps into something it flips over and doesn't move until you flip it back over. If you're getting this toy to have your cat playing on their own forget it. It doesn't move on carpet. Glad it didn't cost much.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Greatest Cat Toy Ever
customer_reviews.text: The Hexbug is the perfect automated cat toy. It moves very much like a bug our mouse scurries on its rubbery feet. It turns around when it runs into an obstacle and it rights itself when it flips over. I have hardwood floors and it works perfectly. It does not work well on my area rugs, I assume experiences will vary based on individual rug orcarpet pile, shagginess, etc. My cat loves it, and I think i love that she loves it even more than she loves it, and that's a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Best Nano bug I've found
customer_reviews.text: I bought two similar nano bugs right from the pet store and they were total garbage. They just go in circles and get stuck under the furniture until you go dig it out... And when the cat flips them they stay stuck on their backs until you pick it up and turn it over. But this one I bought from amazon is great! It runs all around the house in different directions keeping the cat interested. And if it comes to a wall under your furniture it turns itself around and comes back out. And when the cat flips it over it always flips itself upright and continues on!
customer_reviews.author: Ayame

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Louder than what I thought, can't change direction at all, and the string is easily tearable so that the pom pom is no longer there at the end. It alarms my cat instead of entertaining her. The toy vibrates and goes in any direction. The toy itself is made very cheaply if you look upclose and the battery it uses is inconvenient. Overall I had to return and I would not recommend for a friend nor is it giftable.
customer_reviews.author: Leucon

customer_reviews.title: Your cat will like this.
customer_reviews.text: I put them in the bathtub now. When you turn them loose in the house, they act like real bugs. They get into areas where you can't reach them, and then you have to listen to them buzz buzz buzz until they battery wears out. The cat does love them though. I have to cut the tails off because they get stuck on the drain stop.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hexbot-proof the house!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love these better than any toy I've ever bought, but for the time being, I have to keep them hidden. (I ordered one for each of my two Toms), because one bot found its way under my stove, and into a small hole leading under the adjacent cabinet, where I couldn't get it. I had to listen to the constant buzzing noise ( about a half an hour), until my son came home from work and was able to fish it out for me with a wire coat hanger. My cats will be thrilled when I find the perfect play area for their beloved hexbot bugs!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Cat Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This toy is much smaller than I thought it would be. The bug itself is about the size of a AAA battery and drags a little tail behind it. My cat doesn't care about the size; she loves it. In the past she has lost interest in toys after a couple days, but she searches the house for this little bug and rescues it when it gets stuck. She's 12 so she doesn't play with it so much as sneak around and follow it, but she enjoys herself nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Meowgi

customer_reviews.title: great toy
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 cats, 2 older (11 & 16 yrs) and 2 young (1.5yrs). The older 2 could not be bothered to acknowledge these, however the 2 young ones love these toys! They will sit by one and mew so one of us will turn it on. I ended up buying more because they get "misplaced" and take a while for one of the humans find it. They do not have a great battery life. I was able to buy the batteries they need in bulk for a few dollars. The young kitties love these so much it was well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: sparkle plenty

customer_reviews.title: Annoying
customer_reviews.text: I wished it only went in circles like other reviewers said. If it did that, it wouldn't have gotten stuck under my fridge for half an hour before I had to go to work. How frustrating. And the whirring sound is annoying and is kind of loud and scares my cat. She only tries to hit it once I turn it off or it gets stuck on something. We're not thrilled with this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: The actual bug works great but the toy on the back was not enough to get my cat to play with it. She just watched it from a distance until I added some feathers to the back. It also gets stuck on things. I had it for one day and now it’s nowhere to be found because I left it alone for five minutes. Tore my whole room apart looking for it but nope, it’s gone! I wonder if it wandered off under my door somewhere. Anyway, my cat loved it once i spruced it up a bit. Id buy it again (i probably have to anyway) lol
customer_reviews.author: Drew A

customer_reviews.title: It’s all fun and games until
customer_reviews.text: This was a great stocking stuffer for my cats. For all of 15 minutes they loved it. Then, the unthinkable happened! It crawled it’s way under the fridge, got stuck and rattled for hours. I’m not able to pull the fridge out on my own with a back injury. So that thing rattled forever! Great battery life lol. My cats are still traumatized whenever they walk near the fridge. They know, it’s lurking.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle W

customer_reviews.title: My cats like it
customer_reviews.text: The first day, my youngest cat, 10 years old, watched it for 2 hours. I made a cardboard bridge for it to go under and she loved that. It does get stuck sometimes. She brings it to me to turn it on. Now I wait a period of time before running it so she keeps interest. It does go through batteries, so stock up. Also, if you run it in the kitchen, block the refrig well. I was not able to retrieve it and had to purchase another one. It works well on our foyer and contains it. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Bunnie

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it but carry it off
customer_reviews.text: This is the best cat toy for picky cats; they can’t resist it. What is a bummer is that if you don’t watch them all the time, it gets lost; it’s tiny. I’ve bought many. I’m still on the lookout for a remote control toy that isn’t large/bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Adamkewicz

customer_reviews.title: fun but uncooperative
customer_reviews.text: one of my cats liked it right out of the box, the other decided later on he likes it too so all things considered if you think your cat will like it, I'd say try it. but it isn't able to flip itself upright half the time when is knocked upside down, and the little tail easily catches in the legs making it go in a tiny circle. the pattern isn't random either, it's just a clockwise circle. but like i said, my cats love it, and that's all i care about
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: This is neat, works well, but they have a better one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cats and one of them likes it, but got bored with it quickly. Then I bought the Hexbug cat toy that looks like a mouse and it is far superior. I'd say spend the extra money to get that one (it's by the same company). The reason I say that is because it has different modes of operation unlike this one. This one is just a switch on or off. The mouse looking one will scurry away for a bit then stop, then scurry away again and stop a few times, then it will start back up when the cat touches it. It's perfect! My cats love that one.
customer_reviews.author: JosephLucas

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend getting for the cats and entertainment for anyone watching them
customer_reviews.text: Omg this item is great. Right out of the package I had all cats going crazy.batteries last a reasonably long time and since it vibrates our cats aren't able to try to chew on it and destroy it right away. Even the feather at the end seems attached well enough. It wiggles its way around any hard floor and changes direction very life like if something gets in its way. Our cats we actually smacking each other for the opportunity to catch and run off with it. Highly recommend it for hours of entertainment for the cats as well as us.
customer_reviews.author: crazytekkieTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Happy cat
customer_reviews.text: The cat loves this. It seems dumb and cheap, but it really does entertain him. It moves on little rubbery legs because of vibration, which means it also makes a fun buzzing noise. The noise changes when it flips over or hits things. Really keeps the cat interested. It gets stuck under things constantly and showcases how much dust is under my furniture. I'm happy with the item for the price, and would pay more for better features. It would be cool if it turned off and on randomly, or slowed down and sped up, or had some sort of roomba technology to avoid hitting things. Really neat little cat toy. Definitely worth the five bucks. Cat approved.
customer_reviews.author: HBS

customer_reviews.title: My Cats Are Obsessed
customer_reviews.text: I saw this toy advertised on my favorite cat blogger's page one day and decided to get one to see how my cats like it. They are obsessed with it. I need to get a couple more so they will stop fighting over who gets to run off with it. They all need one of their own. The only thing that is drawback is when it gets knocked over, it makes a loud buzzing sound and one of the cats gets scared.
customer_reviews.author: Miss_Kiki

customer_reviews.title: They love it! You will need to supervise
customer_reviews.text: They love it! You will need to supervise. If you wanted something for your cat to play with while you did something else. Wrong toy. The first thing one of my cats did was put the whole thing in her mouth and she started gagging. I recommend tying a ribbon in the end. Makes it easy to pull out from furniture when it gets stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Kiwi & Zom

customer_reviews.title: Cute invention. But I get more exercise than the ...
customer_reviews.text: Cute invention . But I get more exercise than the cats . I have to keep getting up because it is ALWAYS getting stuck some where . It went under the refrigerator once and as I moved the refrigerator to retrieve it, the little bugger kept moving around not wanting to come out . I think I will give it to my grand children . LOL !
customer_reviews.author: M. Mcdowell

customer_reviews.title: The kitties approve
customer_reviews.text: My kitties went ballistic over this toy. It vibrates and runs all over the place. If you give it a few seconds it does tend to right itself up if knocked over. Just keep in mind that it needs hard floors to work and will not work on carpet. It can get stuck under furniture so I wouldn't just set it and forget about it but I don't mind, watching my kitties fight over it is incredibly entertaining.
customer_reviews.author: rhino

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME TOY!
customer_reviews.text: Got one. Then two more. Then two more. Great toys keeping cats entertained. The cons: - easy to lose - buy bulk spare batteries as the battery might be dead the next time you see it Even with these negative points I strongly recommend this toy to anyone. Cats love them and go crazy after them. Just keep a screwdriver and spare batteries close by
customer_reviews.author: Lionel L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Cat Toy!
customer_reviews.text: This kept the interest of 2 out of 3 of my cats. My outdoor cat wasn't impressed as she likes the real deal. The only negative is you have to keep an eye on your cat playing with it. It easily gets stuck under furniture (couches). We lost track of ours and couldn't find it and the battery ended up running all night and dying. We found it the next morning in another room.
customer_reviews.author: Janellemp

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My cats adore this toy and will catch and release it over and over again for as long as I'll let them. The only real drawback is the battery life, which is not fantastic but livable, and the only 'danger' is the bit of fuzz tied on the end. It is EXTREMELY easy for a cat to 'eat' bits of the fuzz and when they're stimulated by a prey-like toy they're pretty darn likely to do it. My cat did and threw up neon floof. It's dangerous for cats to ingest synthetic fibers so I replaced the neon floof with a bit of sturdier but no less brightly colored fabric and tah dah- cat safe!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Albritton

customer_reviews.title: Perplexed
customer_reviews.text: It's Monday and I got this nano toy on Saturday...we played with it an hour on the first day and less on the second day and it died...no way can this be the longevity of the battery. I turn it on and can see something spinning fast then it stops. I tried turning it on again and now it works... I'm perplexed
customer_reviews.author: M. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great, fun, cats love it........then lost!! Way too tiny!!
customer_reviews.text: Great, fun, exciting for my cats......GONE! Great toy but way way too tiny! My cats loved it, but I had to stand there and watch them play, so it didn’t disappear. As soon as I put it on the floor , Sunny, (in the video) smacked it under the fridge! Luckily, when it’s stuck it vibrates loudly, so you can retrieve it. It’s really tiny. I got tired of watching walked away and now the five cats are looking for it! I don’t hear it , so I’ll have to wait and see it they find it. They are upset because it’s lost. This would be great if it were larger! Hope it turns up.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for hyperactive kittens!
customer_reviews.text: Great fun for my younger cat, a little scary for my older cat. This kept my younger cat (1 year old) entertained for hours. It does go in repetitive small circles, but that's still fun for her and depending on the obstacles (books, chairs, tables, etc), it ends up going on a wild course that my cat can't resist! I do recommend this if you have a hyper kitten that you need to keep entertained. I work from home so this is good for me to keep her busy and out of the way. It doesn't always flip on it's side on it's own, but that's fine; it rattles and my cat flips it over eventually anyway!
customer_reviews.author: jes

customer_reviews.title: Goes in Circles, Battery Doesn't Last an Hour
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this. I thought it would do different things but there's just an on/off switch. At first it went in circles when the battery was strong. This did not excite my cat. When the battery got low, it finally went in a straight-ish line, but if it bumps into anything at all, will just sit there vibrating. It's not the toy's fault my cat is boring but I wished the toy could do more. The battery, given the toys size & needs doesn't last long. About an hour if you don't turn it off. :(
customer_reviews.author: Objective Reader of DescriptionsTop Contributor: Calligraphy

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats!
customer_reviews.text: Sgt. Quark Amaya McFluffers loves this. I have two versions of this. One that has the tail and one without the tail. The video is the one with the tail, but my cat loves both. The one with the tail is just as interesting as then he can snag the tail and flip it around, then watch it trundle away before he pounces again. And the nice thing, is all I gotta do is block off any corners it can get stuck under, and then I can read while my cat has the best day ever. I only have to just turn the hexbug around when it gets stuck to send it back on its way.
customer_reviews.author: A.A.Z

customer_reviews.title: Not like their mouse toys :(
customer_reviews.text: I've bought the mice from this company & my cat loves them, so I thought this one would be similar. It doesn't have the run/pause/run sequence or the touch sensor that the mice do, so it ran around constantly for a while and then the battery died in a single day, before my cat even started warming up to it. Plus, it seemed significantly louder than the mice.
customer_reviews.author: Jezunya

product_meta.title: HEXBUG nano Robotic Cat Toy - Interactive Automated Cat Toy, Stimulate Hunting Instinct of Your Feline and Create Exercising Opportunities - Ships Assorted
product_meta.description: With an uncanny sense of balance, this interactive cat toy can autonomously navigate around objects, find its way out of corners and flip over from its back to its feet in an attempt to escape its feline captor. Introducing the playfully energetic HEXBUG Nano Robotic Cat Toy. When turned on, this robot's realistic irregular behavior will fool many cats and even some humans into thinking it's a real bug stimulating your furry friend's hunting instincts The adventurous critter scampers and scurries around using the science of vibration technology, as its soft and colorful feather tail drags behind calling the attention of nearby cats. Exercising your cat has never been easier with this easy to use indoor toy. The sporadic directional change will undoubtedly help your feline engage in regular exercise for a healthier life The styles and colors are selected randomly at the time of shipment based on availability. Only works on hard surfaces WARNING: Remove toy from pet if any part becomes loose, damaged or detached. Intended for pets only. Not a children's toy. Pets should be supervised when playing with this or any other toy. Do not allow any pet to eat this toy.
feature_bullets: AUTOMATIC DIRECTIONAL CHANGE Using the power of vibration technology, the HEXBUG nano Robotic Cat Toy will autonomously navigate around your home and change direction on its own when it bumps into obstacles making any time playtime for your feline friend.
EXERCISING PET TOY The Hex bug nano Robotic Cat Toy is for stimulating your cats hunting instinct by allowing them to chase and trap their unsuspecting prey.
PERFECT CAT LOVER TOY The unique design of the HEXBUG nano Robotic Cat Toy is budget friendly to be the perfect toy for any cat owner in your life (and their cat of course).

WHAT IS HEXBUG HEXBUG is a brand of tech toys for kids with roots in creating innovative children's toys based around insects. Now, HEXBUG has a range of entertaining kids toys and other creative products to help aspiring children cultivate a love for STEM and STEM products.

HEXBUG nano Robotic Cat Toy might have difficulty moving in thick carpet and is best suitable for flat surfaces. This toy was intended for use with pets only and should not be used as a children's toy. This product is not remote controlled.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
